title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2 HUMANITARIAN Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) RESPONSE

description.narrative: Output 2.2 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and vulnerable populations receive gender responsive and life-saving emergency Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, adolescents and women, especially the most vulnerable, have improved access to equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation, hygiene practices and healthy environments

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2 IDPs and vulnerable populations receive gender responsive and life-saving emergency WASH services

description.narrative: Despite continued conflict and sporadic clashes, COVID-19, malnutrition crises, low emergency funding and major economic challenges, UNICEF made progress in advancing the rights to basic water and basic sanitation. WASH programme provided comprehensive gender sensitive life-saving interventions to IDP’s and host communities in the protracted crises of Yemen and contributed to more than 70 % of overall WASH cluster response in-country. This work was done through the provision of safe and sustained access to drinking water supply to more than over 8.8 million people | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:13/01/2022
